Issues.Title: WPF ObservableCollection issue
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.1
* Windows version: 1909 (OS Build 18363.778)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
When binding an Observable collection to a control's visibility, it is not working/updating.
Logging the converter shows that initially null comes in, then an empty list shows up.
So the button is not displayed even though it has 2 items.
It works fine for the other button which uses ObservableCollection.Count
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
Visibility is not working probably because some update is not triggered.

 **Expected behavior:**
Visibility of button updates accordingly if items are added to the collection.

 **Minimal repro:**
https://github.com/richo-tri/WpfObservableCollectionVisibility
The "This button is broken" button doesn't appear even though I believe it should
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF ObservableCollection issue" (#2957)

Issues.Title: .net core WPF System.Windows.ResourceDictionary warning miss details
Issues.Body: * .NET Core Version: 3.1 * Windows version: Windows 10 **Problem description:** When we debug or Run the WPF application it works fine but in output window so many lines are coming with warning ``` System.Windows.ResourceDictionary Warning: 9 : Resource not found; ``` It does not provide any details to tell me which resource missed. And this warning causes the UI to become slower and slower at debugging time the output window: the same message in diagnostic tool window" How can i get the full output information?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".net core WPF System.Windows.ResourceDictionary warning miss details" (#2956)

Issues.Title: Selected value in ComboBox within the DataGridTemplateColumn is cleared on mouse wheel
Issues.Body:
**Problem description:**
Selected value in ComboBox within the DataGridTemplateColumn is cleared on mouse wheel
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 I have created a sample with DataGridTemplateColumn which contains ComboBox as DataTemplate. I add a new object to the underlying collection which is bound to the DataGrid by clicking on a button. So that a new row will be added to the DataGrid template column. 

Once a new row has been inserted, I select an item from the newly added row's ComboBox and continue to add further rows to the DataGrid same like this. After inserting several rows, If I scroll down to the last row and scroll up to the first row using mouse wheel, the items selected in the row's ComboBox are cleared and the ComboBoxes are displayed with empty text.

 **Expected behavior:**
 The selected item in the ComboBox should not be cleared.
 **Minimal repro:**
Please find the sample application to reproduce this from the following link.

[DataGrid_TemplateColumn.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/4546456/DataGrid_TemplateColumn.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Selected value in ComboBox within the DataGridTemplateColumn is cleared on mouse wheel" (#2952)

Issues.Title: Document licensing of PresentationNative, D3DCompiler, and WpfGfx in runtime.win-x86.microsoft.windowsdesktop.app
Issues.Body:
This nuget package https://dotnetfeed.blob.core.windows.net/dotnet-windowsdesktop/flatcontainer/runtime.win-x86.microsoft.windowsdesktop.app/3.0.0-preview5-27610-56/runtime.win-x86.microsoft.windowsdesktop.app.3.0.0-preview5-27610-56.nupkg contains PresentationNative, D3DCompiler, and WpfGfx, which I understand are meant to be released using the .NET Library License, not the MIT license as their presence in this package would suggest.

I suggest documenting the licensing of these components somewhere in the package.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Document licensing of PresentationNative, D3DCompiler, and WpfGfx in runtime.win-x86.microsoft.windowsdesktop.app" (#2939)

Issues.Title: replace ttf file and FontFamily from it
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1
* Windows version: Windows 10 (Version 10.0.18363.778)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes

 
 **Problem description:**
I have to set TextBlock FontFamily from a static-name ttf file. everything is ok until i replace it programatically with another font file (it's about temp of some theme structure); then font callBacks to default. when i restart program it works again.
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
showing default font after replacing font file.

 **Expected behavior:**
address static path to file and use, even if the file is not the primary.
 
 **Minimal repro:**
https://github.com/qwerty13/Wpf-local-font-bug
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "replace ttf file and FontFamily from it" (#2937)

Issues.Title: Certain MSBuild configuration causes _wpftmp build output directories to not be deleted after each build
Issues.Body:
.NET Core 3.1.201
Windows 10 build 18363

 **Problem description:**

Certain MSBuild configuration causes the compiler to leave behind directories with a `_wpftmp` suffix after a build completes. The problem seems to be related to custom `<BaseOutputPath>`s.
 
 **Actual behavior:**

Temporary output directories are left behind after every build. A new directory is created per build.
 
 **Expected behavior:**

Temporary output directories are deleted after every build.
 
 **Minimal repro:**

[WpfApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/4526132/WpfApp1.zip)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40613229/80165374-5fb6bc80-85a9-11ea-80ac-109c3d227437.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Certain MSBuild configuration causes _wpftmp build output directories to not be deleted after each build" (#2930)

Issues.Title: System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer not implemented in core?
Issues.Body:
I'm trying to migrate some of the Wpf application from .net framework to .net core, then I cannot find a replacement of the System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer which exists in the System.Speech.dll.
And the [msdn docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.speech.synthesis.speechsynthesizer?view=netframework-4.8) says not supported in .net core.
Is this removed or how can we use the speech function in Windows 10 without Azure Speech Services?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer not implemented in core?" (#2935)
